snippet: Mark Sanchez’s knack for committing costly turnovers resurfaced. Geno Smith, also competing for the Jets’ starting quarterback job, injured an ankle but said he would be fine.
abstract: Ben Shpigel On Pro Football column; New York Jets lose preseason opener to Detroit Lions, 26-17; Jets quarterback Mark Sanchez goes 10 of 13 passing for 125 yards, with one touchdown and one interception; Geno Smith, Sanchez's competitor for the starting job, leaves in third quarter with ankle injury.
lead_paragraph: Mark Sanchez’s knack for committing costly turnovers resurfaced. Geno Smith, also competing for the Jets’ starting quarterback job, injured an ankle but said he would be fine.

headline.main: Sanchez Throws for Two Touchdowns, One for Each Team
headline.print_headline: Sanchez Throws for Two Touchdowns, One for Each Team
